channel.title: Starting suggestions?
channel.description: Hello guys, first off im new. New to pretty much everything, but im very interested in this. So what would be a good server/client to start out with? maybe like basic to intermediate things?

item.title: Starting suggestions?
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

Malachai:

Hello guys, first off im new. New to pretty much everything, but im very interested in this. So what would be a good server/client to start out with? maybe like basic to intermediate things?

Rather than jump right into Hyperion or something that probably would teach you better, I would start with something like Delta or PI because they have a lot of tutorials. If you’re brand new, you probably don’t care about how well the code is, you just want to enjoy adding content. (Atleast that’s how I was, and still partially am). If I had never stopped using Delta, I probably never would have taken a year and a half long break from programming, and would know alot more about it than I do right now.
[size=1pt]
inb4flameForEncouragingBadPractice[/size]

Read full topic

item.title: Starting suggestions?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

You should start with whatever source makes you comfortable. People don’t seem to realize it but if someone who felt comfortable using Project Insanity and knew the ins and outs of it then they could probably make something much better made and more enjoyable than someone forcing themselves to use Runesource or Hyperion. That’s not to say that Runesource isn’t better made, but how much fun it is to play is more based upon the developer’s ability to make content, not what he started with.

An example would be when playing Battlefield; some people can only get 5 kills a game when using the support class, and yet 25+ when using Recon. It’s the opposite for me, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting suggestions?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:21, topic:478170”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=596368.msg4200499#msg4200499 date=1358121165]

RuneSource isn’t a good source imo.

please, continue to mindlessly post stupid shit. Why isn’t it a good source?

as soon as someone posts something that some else doesn’t agree with they go off to be stupid loveing idiots and act like they know everything. Thats why theres like noone on this forum anymore thats intelligent… even Graham is active on r-s and not here.

Yes pi is 1000 times better then runesource huh

He never said that. I, personally, dislike RuneSource’s design, which is what I think he was referring to because we had this conversation on Skype a few days ago.

Runesource is based off of the WinterLove design, the server was made as a proof of concept. As for what is easy you won’t get a real answer for that, you will either get the people who know how to program saying one thing, then you will have those who think they know how to program saying another thing, and then you will get those people who have no clue how to program saying yet another code base… My suggestion is that you read up the Java docs and then either use a framework or write your own. Once you figure things out and start writing cool code, you can still ask around the forums or even go onto irc and talk about different approaches such as in game design or which algorithm you want to implement.
[/quote]

I’m totally aware of what the design is based off of, I’m aware of Blake’s purpose in writing RuneSource, and I’ve already written several bases and been a part of a few Framework developments myself, I’m not new to this, unless your reply was not directed towards me.[/quote]

The only part of my comment that was even remotely directed to you is the part about Runesource, the rest is for the thread owner. If you reread my comment you will see that I was answering their question, although I could have spaced it or even added an @ to it, but I didn’t nor did I need to. Please don’t try and act like you’re all big here.

Read full topic
